result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Trial Scheduling Order; signed on 07-05-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III
Cash bond amended to $500.  Remaining $2000 to be refunded to poster.

Jury status hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. 
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Case called at 9:31 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jeremy A Schmidt in court with attorney Robert Thomas Ruth.  
Attorney Ruth requests that the Cash Bail be LOWERED.  State has no objection.
Court will LOWER the Cash Bail to $500.00 with same conditions as previously set.
Court will REFUND the $2,000.00 to the poster.
Attorney Ruth requests that the case be set on the trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:40 PM Defendant Jeremy A Schmidt in court, in person with attorney Robert Thomas Ruth by zoom video.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss count 1 without prejudice.  No objection from defense.  Court grants the motion to dismiss Count 1.  Court orders Count 1 dismissed without prejudice.  Attorney Ruth requests to address the cash bail in this matter.  State is not prepared to proceed today.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED as to the remaining counts.  The Court will set this matter for a further proceedings date and a bail hearing before Judge Melvin so the State has notice bail will be addressed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney request to appear by zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 05-11-2022. Granted for this hearing only.

Request to schedule as Motion hearing.

Motion to dismiss count 1.
